did.unittitle: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia Division of Environmental Research records

bioghist.p: In 1948, long before water pollution and environmental degradation became topics of public concern, the Academy established the Environmental Research Division. This marked the beginning of a broadened research orientation for the Academy, which included applied research in aquatic ecosystems as well as the traditional systematics research--discovering and cataloguing organisms.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the Division of Environmental Research of the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia. Many of the papers come from the office of L.E. Sage, but correspondence of Ruth Patrick, and Roger Thomas can also be found in the collection. Office records include:administrative correspondence, 1960s-1980s; project proposals, planning documents, and reports; contacts in business and industry, 1980s to 1995; maps; personnel evaluations; site and space plans; publications, including copies of ANSP Environmental Research Reports and Environmental Monitoring Studies; reprints of articles by staff members; photocopies of newspaper publicity clippings 1948-1984; procedure manuals; a proposal for a Delaware River Environmental Research and Education Center; proceedings of the Schuylkill River Symposium (1980); and an oversize architectural renderings of the Academy of Natural Sciences Estuarine Research Facility in St. Leonard, Maryland. The collection also includes data sheets for several projects from 1958 to 1979 and for the Potomac Electric Power Company Chalk Point project from the mid 1970s to the 1980s.
